title: Nadan Mutta (Egg Curry)

ingredients.content: 20 g fresh root ginger, peeled, cut in round slices (2 mm)
1 small handful fresh coriander leaves, chopped, for garnish (approx. 5 g)

preparations.content: Place coconut oil and fennel seeds in mixing bowl then fry <b>5 min/100°C/speed <b>.
Add onions and chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then sauté <b>10 min/120°C/speed <b>.
Add ginger and garlic then chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add ground coriander, cumin, chilli powder, pepper and turmeric then fry <b>1 min/100°C/speed 0.5<b>.
Add passata and salt then simmer <b>10 min/98°C/speed 0.5<b>.
Place eggs in a serving bowl and pour over sauce, cover with cling film, then leave to heat through for 5 minutes. Serve garnished with chopped coriander leaves.

hintsAndTricks: This is a very popular dish in Kerala where it is often served as breakfast with fermented rice pancakes (dosa). Also known as egg roast, eggs are boiled and served with a fresh onion and tomato sauce that can be fiery or not, should you wish to decrease the chillies. It makes a protein-packed vegetarian main, or a side dish.
